bug.author: rohithkodali
bug.summary: error while creating a model for new language
bug.description:
I have created everything needed for a language using spacy-dev-resources and everything worked well till creating brown vector files, the next command is to create a model out of what i have generated till now here is the command python -m spacy init-model lang ././data/model/lang/vocab ./data/model/lang/lang_wiki.freqs ./data/model/lang/brown/paths ./data/model/lang/lang_wiki.word2vec.bz2 But it throw the error as below, File "/usr/lib/python2.7/runpy.py", line 174, in run_module_as_main "main", fname, loader, pkg_name) File "/usr/lib/python2.7/runpy.py", line 72, in run_code exec code in run_globals File "/usr/local/lib/python2.7/dist-packages/spacy/main.py", line 31, in plac.call(commands[command]) File "/usr/local/lib/python2.7/dist-packages/plac_core.py", line 324, in call parser = parser_from(obj) File "/usr/local/lib/python2.7/dist-packages/plac_core.py", line 133, in parser_from parser.populate_from(obj) File "/usr/local/lib/python2.7/dist-packages/plac_core.py", line 257, in populate_from a = Annotation.from(ann) File "/usr/local/lib/python2.7/dist-packages/plac_core.py", line 91, in from return cls(*obj) File "/usr/local/lib/python2.7/dist-packages/plac_core.py", line 78, in init assert abbrev is None, abbrev AssertionError: f tried all possible options like setting up again on python3 and retrain the model but still the same issue <denchmark-h:h2>My Environment</denchmark-h>
Python version: 2.7.12 Platform: Linux-4.4.0-103-generic-x86_64-with-Ubuntu-16.04-xenial spaCy version: 2.0.5 Models: en-1.1.0, cache, en_glove_cc_300_1m_vectors-1.0.0

comments.comment: Sorry about this â€“ I think this is actually related to a bug in the command arguments (a mismatched abbreviation of the argument). The issue has already been fixed in <denchmark-link:https://github.com/explosion/spaCy/pull/1710>#1710</denchmark-link> and will be included in the next release. In the meantime, you can just make the same edit to and it should work.

i made that change but this is the current issue python -m spacy init-model lang ./data/model/lang/spacy_model ./data/model/lang/lang_wiki.freqs -c ./data/model/lang/brown/paths -v ./data/model/lang/lang_wiki.word2vec.bz2 usage: spacy init-model [-h] [-c None] [-v None] [-V -1] lang output_dir freqs_loc all files are in place, don't know what missing
This thread has been automatically locked since there has not been any recent activity after it was closed. Please open a new issue for related bugs.
